events.description: Macy’s Fireworks spectacular and Nathan’s Hot Dog Eating Contest, both major Independence Day traditions drawing huge crowds and national media.
Citywide series of free outdoor concerts offering a mix of genres; programming across July and August in parks throughout all boroughs.
Free performances of Shakespeare’s Othello (July) and Twelfth Night (August onward), drawing major crowds after renovations to the iconic open-air stage.
NYC’s 400th anniversary expanded this car-free festival citywide for five consecutive Saturdays, closing streets to traffic for art, performances, and recreation.
20th anniversary of the Roaring ‘20s celebration with jazz, vintage dancing, period costumes, cocktails, and vintage cars.
Immersive exhibition pairing Van Gogh’s floral-inspired art installations by day with drone ‘Starry Night’ light shows at dusk.

events.location: Harlem, Flushing Meadows, Sixth Ave, Commodore Barry Park
events.description: Includes Harlem Week, Hong Kong Dragon Boat Festival, Dominican Day Parade, and Afropunk—all large-scale August celebrations of heritage and arts.

events.location: USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center, Flushing Meadows
events.description: The annual Grand Slam tennis championship brings international athletes and fans, dominating NYC’s late August and Labor Day sporting scene.
Lady Gaga's high-profile residency, ‘Mayhem Ball Tour,’ played six blockbuster shows with viral social media buzz.
Week of global climate, energy, and sustainability events in tandem with the UN General Assembly, drawing international attention.
